text:
Here's "Vuppets", my new #webVR experiment made with @aframevr! A proof of concept on virtual puppets. Stand-up comedian/ventriloquist type? You'll love it! Works on 3 and 6DOF headsets, runs great on Go's @mozillareality FF Reality + @oculus browser.
https://www.jorgefuentes.net/projects/vuppets …
embed:
Here's "Vuppets", my new #webVR experiment made with @aframevr! A proof of concept on virtual puppets. Stand-up comedian/ventriloquist type? You'll love it! Works on 3 and 6DOF headsets, runs great on Go's @mozillareality FF Reality + @oculus browser.https://t.co/DXASWbgScJ pic.twitter.com/eAqXMCwVEt

— Jorge Fuentes (@jorgefuentesnet) November 14, 2018

text: For tech minded people - @RevealKl is a web app using #AR #ARjs #bootstrap & @aframevr - this brew enables us to use #WebRTC & build an #iOS11 > #android project. No app! Come & have a go. Built by @in_collusion @viralinfo @ribenno & @ChrisTylerDev https://revealkl.com/

text: People tell us @aframevr is a go-to when they need some secret sauce to scoop up a hackathon or competition. Used by @toyota and won @W3Awards. Congrats, @rotorstudios!

quote.text: Woohoo! The @W3Awards'18 winners have been announced and we are proud to have won 🥇&🥈 for the multiple award-winning Camry WebGL Configurator (http://customise.toyota.com.au/camry/ ) built using @aframevr and #threejs 🥳 pic.twitter.com/F1SL3NFUZR

embed:

— Kevin Ngo (@andgokevin) November 22, 2018

text:
